DNA was extracted using the high salt method
58 from a total of 182 animals. Seven microsatellite primers (Table 1) identified for O. vulgaris
59 were amplified in O. tetricus and found to be polymorphic. The microsatellites loci revealed a moderate level of heterozygosity (Table 3) with two loci exhibiting more than 10 alleles at each site (Supplementary Tables S3, S4). Microsatellite loci were assigned unique fluorophores (FAM, VIC, NED, PET)
60 to enable fluorescent tagging of PCR products.
